text: Oh you mean an embedded iframe?
+1 to what <@U03FJQPSC0Y> said. Here's a screenshot reference of what you should be able to see on the left nav

Thanks for showing that, I randomly scrolled and found all components but at first sight it only seems to be one and the scrollbar is hidden lol. I'm not sure if I'm using this correctly but I created another Figma file and started copying components from the HubSpot Figma file, then it took some learning to work with the bigger components but I ended up with a good mockup, better than the ones I built with lucid before (much better) so I think im good now.

Yes, that's exactly how it is meant to be used (creating a copy of the file / copying components from there). Glad to hear it and feel free to pass along any feedback / painpoints. We'd love to know more about your experienc!.

Awesome, I do have feedback but I need to go over a few rounds with the customer and I might need to add or edit more components. After that I'll make sure to leave feedback with the process that is outlined. Thanks for the early access.

:question:*Question from HubSpot product team on data fetching for UI extensions*
We want to understand how you deal with data inside HubSpot when you build your extensions and what are the most common painpoints and challenges that you have there.

1. What are the most common HubSpot APIs have you been using. What are some common operations?
2. Any example of some complex operations with data fetched from API calls, or stacking API calls one after another?
3. What has been the most challenging aspect of HubSpot data fetch operations through serverless functions?
4. Do you prefer to use REST or GQL when you deal with HubSpot data?

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C056Q34SH1D/p1687969148040029>

I did this subrows hack a while ago
Thank you guys for the ideas. <@U01QVR44MEY> does that button re-renders the whole table but with more rows?? thats a great idea!
yeah exactly it just pushes some rows into the table rows state and it will rerender automatically
Awesome I'll try that if the panel component doesn't work for the customer. :5892_parrot:
yeah I love using the panel component for stuff like this as well!
Sent you a DM, thanks for taking our feedback into consideration.
